Open-Source Alternatives to Proprietary Enterprise Software

A collaborative list of open-source alternatives to typical government and enterprise software needs

Virtualization

Operation System

Software Consider as Alternative to Comments Real-World Use
  • Linux KVM
  • Xen
  • VMWare vSphere / ESX / Server
  • KVM is rapidly gaining industry support as the leading alternative to the incumbent virtualization platforms. The Open virtualization Alliance which aims to promote KVM over VMWare has more than 160 members including iBM, Redhat, Intel, HP and BMC.
  • Xen pioneered virtualization but is considered to overtaken by KVM based platforms. Citrix offers commercial support for Xen based virtualization.
  • IBM uses KVM as basis for it’s IaaS cloud platform.ref
  • KVM leads other virtualization technologies in SPEC benchmarks.ref and ref
  • Virtualbox
  • VMWare Workstation, Parallels for desktop
  • Desktop virtualization, developed by Sun, now managed by Oracle. Supports features comparable to commercial software including device passthrough. Compatible with a Vmware (vmdk), Microsoft (vhd) and Open virtualization Format (OVF) virtual machine images. Light client only software is ideal for development and testing environments.
  • Oracle’s VDI enterprise product is based on Virtualbox.ref
